verses.verse: Moreover I-yov <S%H347><s%> continued <S%H3254><s%> <S%H8686><s%> <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8800><s%> his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>,

As 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> liveth <S%H2416><s%>, who hath taken away <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8689><s%> my judgment <S%H4941><s%>; and 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>, who hath vexed <S%H4843><s%> <S%H8689><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%>;
All the while <S%H5750><s%> my breath <S%H5397><s%> is in me, and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> is in my nostrils <S%H639><s%>;
My lips <S%H8193><s%> shall not speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%> wickedness <S%H5766><s%>, nor my tongue <S%H3956><s%> utter <S%H1897><s%> <S%H8799><s%> deceit <S%H7423><s%>.

'Elohim forbid <S%H2486><s%> that I should justify <S%H6663><s%> <S%H8686><s%> you: till I die <S%H1478><s%> <S%H8799><s%> I will not remove <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8686><s%> mine integrity <S%H8538><s%> from me.

My righteousness <S%H6666><s%> I hold <S%H2388><s%> <S%H8689><s%> fast, and will not let it go <S%H7503><s%> <S%H8686><s%>: my heart <S%H3824><s%> shall not reproach <S%H2778><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me so long as I live <S%H3117><s%>.
Let mine enemy <S%H341><s%> <S%H8802><s%> be as the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, and he that riseht up <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8693><s%> against me as the unrighteous <S%H5767><s%>.

For what is the hope <S%H8615><s%> of the hypocrite <S%H2611><s%>, though he hath gained <S%H1214><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, when 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> taketh away <S%H7953><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> ?
Will 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his cry <S%H6818><s%> when trouble <S%H6869><s%> cometh <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> upon him?
Will he delight <S%H6026><s%> <S%H8691><s%> himself in 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>? will he always <S%H6256><s%> call <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8799><s%> upon 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> ?
I will teach <S%H3384><s%> <S%H8686><s%> you by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>: that which is with 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%> will I not conceal <S%H3582><s%> <S%H8762><s%>.
Behold, all ye yourselves have seen <S%H2372><s%> <S%H8804><s%> it; why then are ye thus altogether <S%H1892><s%> vain <S%H1891><s%> <S%H8799><s%> ?

This is the portion <S%H2506><s%> of a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H120><s%> with 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>, and the heritage <S%H5159><s%> of oppressors <S%H6184><s%>, which they shall receive <S%H3947><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>.

If his children <S%H1121><s%> be multiplied <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, it is for <S%H3926><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%>: and his offspring <S%H6631><s%> shall not be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with bread <S%H3899><s%>.
Those that remain <S%H8300><s%> of him shall be buried <S%H6912><s%> <S%H8735><s%> in death <S%H4194><s%>: and his widows <S%H490><s%> shall not weep <S%H1058><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.
Though he heap up <S%H6651><s%> <S%H8799><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> as the dust <S%H6083><s%>, and prepare <S%H3559><s%> <S%H8686><s%> raiment <S%H4403><s%> as the clay <S%H2563><s%>;

He may prepare <S%H3559><s%> <S%H8686><s%> it, but the just <S%H6662><s%> shall put it on <S%H3847><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and the innocent <S%H5355><s%> shall divide <S%H2505><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the silver <S%H3701><s%>.
He buildeth <S%H1129><s%> <S%H8804><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%> as a moth <S%H6211><s%>, and as a booth <S%H5521><s%> that the keeper <S%H5341><s%> <S%H8802><s%> maketh <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%>.

The rich <S%H6223><s%> man shall lie down <S%H7901><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, but he shall not be gathered <S%H622><s%> <S%H8735><s%>: he openeth <S%H6491><s%> <S%H8804><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and he is not.
Terrors <S%H1091><s%> take hold <S%H5381><s%> <S%H8686><s%> on him as waters <S%H4325><s%>, a tempest <S%H5492><s%> stealeth him away <S%H1589><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>.

The east <S%H6921><s%> wind carrieth him away <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and he departeth <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: and as a storm hurleth <S%H8175><s%> <S%H8762><s%> him out of his place <S%H4725><s%>.

For 'Elohim shall cast <S%H7993><s%> <S%H8686><s%> upon him, and not spare <S%H2550><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: he would fain <S%H1272><s%> <S%H8800><s%> flee <S%H1272><s%> <S%H8799><s%> out of his hand <S%H3027><s%>.
Men shall clap <S%H5606><s%> <S%H8799><s%> their hands <S%H3709><s%> at him, and shall hiss <S%H8319><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him out of his place <S%H4725><s%>.
